ygData.messageBody:
Do normal bard melee attacks even interrupt a caster? I was always under the
impression that the only melee attack that would interrupt spellcasting was a
bash/slam. For several levels now I have dual wielded thulian claws (DLY 19)
and a dragoon dirk (23 DLY). I have never noticed any of my attacks
interrupting a spell. Granted when a caster is interrupted its hard to tell what
did it. Was it my pixie strike, the paladins bash, or one of our own casters
hitting it with a Stun effect spell. I thought the only way bards could
interrupt spellcasting was with songs like Bellow, Lullaby and Pixie Strike.

Galtin of E'ci


> 1) Hitting to interrupt casters (question: does chance of interruption
> increase with damage done?)
